name: cancel
trans: 取消， 撤销， 删去 (vt.)

trans: 恢复， 使恢复； 修复， 整修； 归还， 交还 (vt.)

sentences.chinese: 我订阅《新科学家》的主要原因是要跟上科学的进步。

trans: 两者选一的， 供选择的； 另类的 (adj.)
替换物，选择；选择的自由 (n.)

trans: 适合的， 恰当的 (adj.)
设备，家具，日用器具；配件，附件，零件；试穿，试衣 (n.)

sentences.chinese: 他们中又来了个新人，那人穿过一块田地大步走过来。

name: census

sentences.english: a traffic census
sentences.chinese: 交通状况调查

sentences.english: There is a willful self-destructiveness in the air here as if America has all the time and money in the world for petty politics.

name: stationary
trans: 固定的， 静止不动的 (adj.)

trans: 阻止， 控制； 抑制， 遏制 (vt.)

name: ruin
trans: 毁坏 (v.)
毁灭；废墟 (n.)

sentences.chinese: 他的事业将被毁掉。

sentences.chinese: 这泥巴会把我的鞋弄坏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 毁坏

detailed_translations.chinese: 毁灭；废墟

name: beforehand
trans: 预先， 事先 (adv.)

detailed_translations.chinese: 预先， 事先

trans: 可怕的， 令人敬畏的； 难以克服的， 难对付的 (adj.)

sentences.chinese: 那幢建筑呈灰色，气势凛然，与漂亮沾不上边。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可怕的， 令人敬畏的； 难以克服的， 难对付的

sentences.chinese: 她摇动摇篮，让宝宝安静下来。

name: assurance
trans: 把握， 信心； 保证， 表示保证的话； 保险 (n.)

sentences.chinese: 当精神病医生选择解除自己神智正常的角色而允许病人解除他们神智错乱的角色时，那么他们每个人就都可以足够康复到回家了。

name: squad
trans: 班， 小队， 小组 (n.)

伤疤，伤痕；创伤 (n.)

sentences.chinese: 个人道德与职业道德之间有时会相冲突。

众多，大量；团，块，堆；群众；质量 (n.)

name: mansion

sentences.chinese: 漂亮的乡村宅第

detailed_translations.chinese: 大厦， 宅邸
detailed_translations.english: a very large house

name: mask

sentences.chinese: 外科手术口罩

sentences.chinese: 他被两个蒙面人袭击并抢劫。

sentences.chinese: 武装卫兵巡逻场地。

sentences.chinese: 由特警部队巡逻的地区

sentences.chinese: …一个装满1分、5分、10分和25分硬币的大玻璃罐。

name: patron

sentences.english: a wealthy patron
sentences.chinese: 富有的赞助人

name: entail

sentences.english: Some foreign travel is entailed in the job.

name: inferior

下级， 下属 (n.)

sentences.english: wine of inferior quality

sentences.english: inferior goods

sentences.english: the government propaganda machine
sentences.chinese: 政府的宣传机器

sentences.english: It is easy to overlook a small detail like that.
sentences.chinese: 那样的小细节很容易被忽略。

sentences.english: Nobody could overlook the fact that box office sales were down.
sentences.chinese: 谁也无法忽视票房销售额在下降这个事实。

detailed_translations.chinese: 忽视； 宽恕； 俯瞰
detailed_translations.english: to not notice something, or not see how important it is

name: refuge
trans: 庇护所， 避难处； 庇护 (n.)

sentences.english: a wildlife refuge
sentences.chinese: 野生动物保护区

detailed_translations.chinese: 庇护所， 避难处； 庇护
detailed_translations.english: shelter or protection from someone or something

name: dramatic
trans: 引人注目的， 激动人心的； 戏剧的 (adj.)

sentences.english: A superb goal by Owen earned United a dramatic victory yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天欧文的一个超级入球为联队赢得了激动人心的胜利。

sentences.english: Some of the most dramatic events in American history happened here.
sentences.chinese: 美国历史上一些最震撼人心的事件发生在这里。

sentences.english: the dramatic scenery of the Grand Canyon
sentences.chinese: 大峡谷的壮丽景致

detailed_translations.chinese: 引人注目的， 激动人心的； 戏剧的
detailed_translations.english: exciting or impressive

name: incredible
trans: 不能相信的， 不可信的， 难以置信的； 惊人的 (adj.)

sentences.english: It’s incredible that he survived the fall.
sentences.chinese: 他跌下去竟然能够生还，真不可思议。

sentences.english: It’s incredible how much Tom has changed since he met Sally.
sentences.chinese: 自从遇见萨莉后，汤姆的变化之大简直令人难以置信。

sentences.english: I find it almost incredible that no one noticed these errors.
sentences.chinese: 没人发现这些错误，真让我无法相信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不能相信的， 不可信的， 难以置信的； 惊人的
detailed_translations.english: too strange to be believed, or very difficult to believe

name: certainty
trans: 必然的事， 确定的事实； 确信， 确实 (n.)

sentences.english: The result is impossible to predict with any degree of certainty .
sentences.chinese: 这一结果完全无法确切预测。

detailed_translations.chinese: 必然的事， 确定的事实； 确信， 确实
detailed_translations.english: the state of being completely certain

name: corrode
trans: 腐蚀， 侵蚀 (v.)

sentences.english: Acidic water will corrode the pipes.
sentences.chinese: 酸性水会腐蚀管子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 腐蚀， 侵蚀
detailed_translations.english: if metal corrodes, or if something corrodes it, it is slowly destroyed by the effect of water, chemicals etc

name: spine
trans: 脊柱， 脊椎； 刺， 刺毛； 书脊 (n.)

sentences.english: cactus spines
sentences.chinese: 仙人掌的刺

detailed_translations.chinese: 脊柱， 脊椎； 刺， 刺毛； 书脊
detailed_translations.english: the row of bones down the centre of your back that supports your body and protects your  spinal cord

name: commend
trans: 称赞， 表扬； 推荐 (vt.)

sentences.english: The paper was highly commended in the UK Press Awards.
sentences.chinese: 该报获得了“英国新闻奖”的高度褒奖。

detailed_translations.chinese: 称赞， 表扬； 推荐
detailed_translations.english: to praise or approve of someone or something publicly

name: parasite
trans: 寄生生物； 寄生虫 (n.)

sentences.english: Kangaroos harbour a vast range of parasites.
sentences.chinese: 袋鼠身上有各种各样的寄生虫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 寄生生物； 寄生虫
detailed_translations.english: a plant or animal that lives on or in another plant or animal and gets food from it

name: artificial
trans: 人工的， 人为的； 矫揉造作的； 模拟的 (adj.)

sentences.english: artificial flowers
sentences.chinese: 假花

sentences.english: artificial light
sentences.chinese: 人造光

sentences.english: artificial fertilizers
sentences.chinese: 化肥

detailed_translations.chinese: 人工的， 人为的； 矫揉造作的； 模拟的
detailed_translations.english: not real or not made of natural things but made to be like something that is real or natural

name: deficiency
trans: 缺乏， 不足； 缺点， 缺陷 (n.)

sentences.english: They did blood tests on him for signs of vitamin deficiency.
sentences.chinese: 他们给他做了血检看是否有缺乏维生素的迹象。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺乏， 不足； 缺点， 缺陷
detailed_translations.english: a lack of something that is necessary

name: imaginary
trans: 想象中的， 假想的 (adj.)

sentences.english: As she listened, she played an imaginary piano on her knees.
sentences.chinese: 她边听边在膝盖上作弹钢琴状。

sentences.english: We must protect older people from harm, whether it is real or imaginary.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须保护老人免受伤害，无论这伤害是真实的还是假想的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 想象中的， 假想的
detailed_translations.english: not real, but produced from pictures or ideas in your mind

name: formula
trans: 公式， 式； 原则， 方案； 配方 (n.)

sentences.english: We’re still searching for a peace formula.
sentences.chinese: 我们仍在寻找和平方案。

sentences.english: There is no magic formula (= a method that is certain to be successful ) that will transform sorrow into happiness.
sentences.chinese: 没有妙方可以化悲为喜。

sentences.english: With viewing figures up a million, the programme has a winning formula .
sentences.chinese: 收视人数增加了一百万，这个节目的确拥有吸引观众的法宝。

detailed_translations.chinese: 公式， 式； 原则， 方案； 配方
detailed_translations.english: a method or set of principles that you use to solve a problem or to make sure that something is successful

name: disgust
trans: 厌恶， 憎恶 (n&vt.)

sentences.english: He reached into the bin with a look of disgust on his face.
sentences.chinese: 他把手伸进垃圾箱，脸上带着厌恶的表情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 厌恶， 憎恶
detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of dislike, annoyance, or disapproval

name: transcend
trans: 超出， 超越范围 (vt.)

sentences.english: The desire for peace transcended political differences.
sentences.chinese: 对和平的渴望超越了政治分歧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 超出， 超越范围
detailed_translations.english: to go beyond the usual limits of something

name: tribute
trans: 颂词， 称赞， 礼物； 贡品 (n.)

sentences.english: The players wore black armbands as a tribute to their late teammate.
sentences.chinese: 球员们戴着黑纱悼念已故的队友。

sentences.english: I’d like to pay tribute to (= praise and admire publicly ) the party workers for all their hard work.
sentences.chinese: 我谨向党内工作人员致敬，感谢他们的辛苦努力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 颂词， 称赞， 礼物； 贡品
detailed_translations.english: something that you say, do, or give in order to express your respect or admiration for someone

name: mob
trans: 暴民，乌合之众 (n.)
成群围住， 聚众袭击 (vt.)

sentences.english: They were immediately surrounded by the mob.
sentences.chinese: 他们立刻被那帮暴民包围了。

sentences.english: The leadership had been criticized for giving in to mob rule (= when a mob controls the situation rather than the government or the law ) .
sentences.chinese: 领导层被批评屈服于暴民统治。

detailed_translations.chinese: 暴民，乌合之众
detailed_translations.english: a large noisy crowd, especially one that is angry and violent

detailed_translations.chinese: 成群围住， 聚众袭击
detailed_translations.english: if people mob a famous person, they rush to get close to them and form a crowd around them

name: subordinate
trans: 下级的，级别低的；次要的，从属的 (adj.)
部属， 下级 (n.)
使处于次要地位， 使从属于 (vt.)

sentences.english: a subordinate officer
sentences.chinese: 下级官员

detailed_translations.chinese: 下级的，级别低的；次要的，从属的
detailed_translations.english: in a less important position than someone else

detailed_translations.chinese: 部属， 下级
detailed_translations.english: someone who has a lower position and less authority than someone else in an organization

detailed_translations.chinese: 使处于次要地位， 使从属于
detailed_translations.english: to put someone or something in a less important position

name: trend
trans: 伸向，倾向 (vi.)
倾向 (n.)

sentences.english: The current trend is towards more part-time employment.
sentences.chinese: 当前的趋势是雇用更多的兼职人员。

sentences.english: the general trend towards the centralization of political power
sentences.chinese: 政治权力集中化的普遍趋势

sentences.english: A disturbing trend is that victims of violence are getting younger.
sentences.chinese: 一个令人担心的趋势是，暴力行为的受害者越来越年轻。

sentences.english: The growing trend is for single mothers to bring up children by themselves.
sentences.chinese: 单身母亲独自抚养孩子的趋势在上升。

sentences.english: Even so, the underlying trend is positive.
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，基本趋势仍是乐观的。

sentences.english: national and international economic trends
sentences.chinese: 国内和国际的经济趋势

sentences.english: the downward trend in the price of gold
sentences.chinese: 黄金价格的下滑势头

sentences.english: Successive presidents have tried to reverse this trend , but without success.
sentences.chinese: 连续几任总统都试图扭转这一趋势，但均未成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 伸向，倾向
倾向
detailed_translations.english: a general tendency in the way a situation is changing or developing

name: achievement
trans: 完成； 成就， 成绩 (n.)

sentences.english: His great achievement is to make all the players into a united team.
sentences.chinese: 他的伟大成就在于把所有选手组织成一支团结的队伍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 完成； 成就， 成绩
detailed_translations.english: something important that you succeed in doing by your own efforts

name: sturdy
trans: 强壮的， 结实的， 坚固的； 坚定的， 坚强的 (adj.)

sentences.english: That chair doesn’t look very sturdy.
sentences.chinese: 那把椅子看上去不太结实。

sentences.english: sturdy comfortable shoes
sentences.chinese: 结实而舒适的鞋子

detailed_translations.chinese: 强壮的， 结实的， 坚固的； 坚定的， 坚强的
detailed_translations.english: an object that is sturdy is strong, well-made, and not easily broken

name: desirable
trans: 吸引人的， 可取的 (adj.)

sentences.english: The ability to speak a foreign language is highly desirable .
sentences.chinese: 能说一门外语是非常理想的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 吸引人的， 可取的

name: consist
trans: 由…组成； 在于； 一致 (vi.)

sentences.english: My diet consisted almost exclusively of chocolate-covered cookies and glasses of milk.
sentences.chinese: 我的饮食几乎只包含裹上巧克力的曲奇饼和一杯杯牛奶。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由…组成； 在于； 一致

name: reliable
trans: 可靠的， 可依赖的 (adj.)

sentences.english: a birth control method that is cheap and reliable
sentences.chinese: 既便宜又可靠的避孕方法

sentences.english: Miller was a quiet and reliable man.
sentences.chinese: 米勒是个话不多且可靠的人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可靠的， 可依赖的
detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is reliable can be trusted or depended on

name: compatible
trans: 兼容的； 能和睦相处的， 合得来的 (adj.)

sentences.english: The new software is IBM compatible (= can be used with IBM computers ) .
sentences.chinese: 这个新软件与IBM的计算机兼容。

detailed_translations.chinese: 兼容的； 能和睦相处的， 合得来的
detailed_translations.english: if two pieces of computer equipment are compatible, they can be used together, especially when they are made by different companies

name: incentive
trans: 刺激， 鼓励 (n.)

sentences.english: As an added incentive, there’s a bottle of champagne for the best team.
sentences.chinese: 给最优秀的队发一瓶香槟作为额外的鼓励。

detailed_translations.chinese: 刺激， 鼓励
detailed_translations.english: something that encourages you to work harder, start a new activity etc

name: critic
trans: 批评家， 爱挑剔的人 (n.)

sentences.english: Mather was a film critic for many years.
sentences.chinese: 马瑟做过多年的电影评论家。

detailed_translations.chinese: 批评家， 爱挑剔的人
detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to make judgments about the good and bad qualities of art, music, films etc

name: preliminary
trans: 预备的，初步的 (adj.)
初步做法， 起始行为 (n.)

sentences.english: the preliminary stages of the competition
sentences.chinese: 竞赛的预赛阶段

sentences.english: a preliminary draft
sentences.chinese: 初稿

detailed_translations.chinese: 预备的，初步的
detailed_translations.english: happening before something that is more important, often in order to prepare for it

detailed_translations.chinese: 初步做法， 起始行为

name: obstacle
trans: 障碍， 障碍物； 妨害 (n.)

sentences.english: The tax puts obstacles in the way of companies trying to develop trade overseas.
sentences.chinese: 这项税收为想在海外发展贸易的公司设置了障碍。

sentences.english: Women still have to overcome many obstacles to gain equality.
sentences.chinese: 妇女要获得平等仍需克服重重障碍。

sentences.english: We want to remove all obstacles to travel between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们想要消除在这两个国家之间旅行的所有障碍。

sentences.english: the single biggest obstacle to a Conservative victory in the next election
sentences.chinese: 保守党在下一届大选中获胜的最大障碍

sentences.english: There are formidable obstacles on the road to peace.
sentences.chinese: 通往和平的道路上存在难以逾越的障碍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 障碍， 障碍物； 妨害
detailed_translations.english: something that makes it difficult to achieve some­thing

name: profession
trans: 职业； 公开表示 (n.)

sentences.english: the medical profession
sentences.chinese: 医学界

detailed_translations.chinese: 职业； 公开表示
detailed_translations.english: a statement of your belief, opinion, or feeling

name: van
trans: 大篷车， 运货车 (n.)

sentences.english: a delivery van
sentences.chinese: 运货车

sentences.english: a van driver
sentences.chinese: 小型货车司机

detailed_translations.chinese: 大篷车， 运货车
detailed_translations.english: a vehicle used especially for carrying goods, which is smaller than a truck and has a roof and usually no windows at the sides

name: dizzy
trans: 头晕目眩的，眩晕的；头晕的 (adj.)
令人发晕 (vt.)

sentences.english: The heat and the champagne made him feel dizzy .
sentences.chinese: 高温和香槟酒使他感到眩晕。

sentences.english: She started to suffer from dizzy spells (= a short period when you feel dizzy ) .
sentences.chinese: 她开始感到一阵阵的眩晕。

detailed_translations.chinese: 头晕目眩的，眩晕的；头晕的
detailed_translations.english: feeling unable to stand steadily, for example because you are looking down from a high place or because you are ill

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人发晕

name: resemblance
trans: 相似， 形似 (n.)

sentences.english: There was a remarkable resemblance between him and Pete.
sentences.chinese: 他和皮特有一个惊人的相似之处。

detailed_translations.chinese: 相似， 形似
detailed_translations.english: if there is a resemblance between two people or things, they are similar, especially in the way they look

name: exceptional
trans: 优越的， 杰出的； 例外的， 独特的， 异常的 (adj.)

sentences.english: an exceptional student
sentences.chinese: 出类拔萃的学生

sentences.english: exceptional bravery
sentences.chinese: 非凡的勇气

detailed_translations.chinese: 优越的， 杰出的； 例外的， 独特的， 异常的
detailed_translations.english: unusually good

name: constitute
trans: 组成， 形成； 设立； 任命 (vt.)

sentences.english: We must redefine what constitutes a family.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须对家庭的构成重新定义。

detailed_translations.chinese: 组成， 形成； 设立； 任命
detailed_translations.english: if several people or things constitute something, they are the parts that form it

name: cherish
trans: 珍爱， 珍视； 爱护， 抚育； 抱有， 怀有 (vt.)

sentences.english: He cherished his privacy.
sentences.chinese: 他很注重自己的隐私。

sentences.english: I cherish the memory of that day.
sentences.chinese: 我珍惜那一天的回忆。

detailed_translations.chinese: 珍爱， 珍视； 爱护， 抚育； 抱有， 怀有
detailed_translations.english: if you cherish something, it is very important to you

name: discrepancy
trans: 不符合， 不一致 (n.)

sentences.english: A modification of the common-origin theory accounts for the density discrepancy .
sentences.chinese: 关于共同起源的理论，有一种改进的论点解释了密度的不符。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不符合， 不一致
detailed_translations.english: a difference between two amounts, details, reports etc that should be the same

name: spectrum
trans: 谱， 光谱， 频谱； 范围， 幅度， 系列 (n.)

sentences.english: The two articles here represent opposite ends of the spectrum .
sentences.chinese: 这里的两篇文章代表了两个极端的观点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谱， 光谱， 频谱； 范围， 幅度， 系列
detailed_translations.english: a complete range of opinions, people, situations etc, going from one extreme to its opposite

name: convince
trans: 使确信， 使信服， 说服 (vt.)

sentences.english: Her arguments didn’t convince everyone, but changes were made.
sentences.chinese: 她的论点不能说服每个人，但还是引起了一些变化。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使确信， 使信服， 说服
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel certain that something is true

name: prolong
trans: 延长， 拉长， 拖延 (vt.)

sentences.english: I was trying to think of some way to prolong the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 我在想方设法拖长这次谈话。

detailed_translations.chinese: 延长， 拉长， 拖延
detailed_translations.english: to deliberately make something such as a feeling or an activity last longer

name: missionary
trans: 传教士 (n.)

sentences.english: My mother would still like me to be a missionary in Africa.
sentences.chinese: 我母亲还是想让我在非洲做一名传教士。

detailed_translations.chinese: 传教士
detailed_translations.english: someone who has been sent to a foreign country to teach people about Christianity and persuade them to become Christians

name: terminate
trans: 停止， 终止 (v.)

sentences.english: The court ruled that the contract must be terminated.
sentences.chinese: 法庭裁决该合同必须终止。

sentences.english: a woman’s decision on whether or not to terminate the pregnancy
sentences.chinese: 女子关于是否终止妊娠的决定

detailed_translations.chinese: 停止， 终止
detailed_translations.english: if something terminates, or if you terminate it, it ends

name: valve
trans: 阀， 活门； 瓣膜， 活瓣 (n.)

sentences.english: heart valves
sentences.chinese: 心脏瓣膜

detailed_translations.chinese: 阀， 活门； 瓣膜， 活瓣
detailed_translations.english: a part of a tube or pipe that opens and shuts like a door to control the flow of liquid, gas, air etc passing through it

name: refund
trans: 退款 (n.)
退还 (vt.)

sentences.english: They refused to give me a refund .
sentences.chinese: 他们拒绝给我退款。

sentences.english: Return your purchase within 14 days for a full refund .
sentences.chinese: 14 天之内退货可以全额退款。

sentences.english: You should go down there and demand a refund.
sentences.chinese: 你应该到那里去，要求退款。

detailed_translations.chinese: 退款
detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that is given back to you if you are not satisfied with the goods or services that you have paid for

detailed_translations.chinese: 退还
detailed_translations.english: to give someone their money back, especially because they are not satisfied with the goods or services they have paid for

name: remnant
trans: 残留部分 (n.)

sentences.english: Beneath the present church were remnants of Roman flooring.
sentences.chinese: 在目前的这座教堂下面还有残余的古罗马地板。

detailed_translations.chinese: 残留部分
detailed_translations.english: a small part of something that remains after the rest of it has been used, destroyed, or eaten

name: internal
trans: 内的， 国内的； 内心的 (adj.)

sentences.english: We have no interest in interfering in the internal affairs of other countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们对干涉其他国家内政不感兴趣。

sentences.english: the threat to internal security
sentences.chinese: 对国内安全的威胁

sentences.english: internal markets
sentences.chinese: 国内市场

detailed_translations.chinese: 内的， 国内的； 内心的
detailed_translations.english: within a particular country

name: literary
trans: 文学的； 文人的， 书卷气的 (adj.)

sentences.english: a literary prize
sentences.chinese: 文学奖

detailed_translations.chinese: 文学的； 文人的， 书卷气的
detailed_translations.english: relating to literature

name: classical
trans: 古典的， 经典的 (adj.)

sentences.english: the classical theory of relativity
sentences.chinese: 经典相对论

detailed_translations.chinese: 古典的， 经典的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to a traditional style or set of ideas

name: privilege
trans: 特权； 优惠 (n.)

sentences.english: He had no special privileges and was treated just like every other prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 他不享受特权，待遇和任何其他犯人一样。

detailed_translations.chinese: 特权； 优惠
detailed_translations.english: a special advantage that is given only to one person or group of people

name: substitute
trans: 代替人，代用品 (n.)
用…代替 (vt.)

sentences.english: Germany brought on a substitute at half time.
sentences.chinese: 德国队在比赛半场时换上一名替补队员。

sentences.english: substitute goalkeeper
sentences.chinese: 替补守门员

detailed_translations.chinese: 代替人，代用品
detailed_translations.english: someone who does someone else’s job for a limited period of time, especially in a sports team or school

detailed_translations.chinese: 用…代替
detailed_translations.english: to use something new or diffe-rent instead of something else

name: mortgage
trans: 抵押，抵押借款 (n.)
抵押 (vt.)

sentences.english: Your building society or bank will help arrange a mortgage.
sentences.chinese: 你加入的购房互助协会或银行将会给你安排抵押贷款。

sentences.english: They’ve taken out a 30 year mortgage (= they will pay for their house over a period of 30 years ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们办理了一笔30年期的抵押贷款。

sentences.english: We decided to use Fred’s redundancy money to pay off the mortgage (= pay back all the money we borrowed for a mortgage ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们决定用弗雷德的遣散费来偿清抵押贷款。

sentences.english: Mortgage rates are set to rise again in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 抵押贷款利率到春季肯定还要上涨。

sentences.english: She was having trouble meeting her mortgage payments .
sentences.chinese: 她还抵押贷款有困难。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抵押，抵押借款
detailed_translations.english: a legal arrangement by which you borrow money from a bank or similar organization in order to buy a house, and pay back the money over a period of years

detailed_translations.chinese: 抵押
detailed_translations.english: if you mortgage your home, land, or property, you borrow money, usually from a bank, and if you cannot pay back the money within a particular period of time, the bank has the right to sell your property in order to get the money you owe it

name: blaze
trans: 熊熊燃烧，着火；发光，放光彩；迸发，爆发 (vi.)
火焰， 烈火； 光辉， 强烈的光； 迸发， 爆发； 灿烂， 炫耀 (n.)

sentences.english: The room was warm, with a fire blazing in the hearth.
sentences.chinese: 房间里暖融融的，壁炉里的火熊熊燃烧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 熊熊燃烧，着火；发光，放光彩；迸发，爆发
detailed_translations.english: to burn very brightly and strongly

detailed_translations.chinese: 火焰， 烈火； 光辉， 强烈的光； 迸发， 爆发； 灿烂， 炫耀
detailed_translations.english: very bright light or colour

name: moreover
trans: 而且， 再者， 此外 (adv.)

sentences.english: The rent is reasonable and, moreover, the location is perfect.
sentences.chinese: 租金合理，而且位置也非常好。

sentences.english: The source of the information is irrelevant. Moreover, the information need not be confidential.
sentences.chinese: 信息来源无关紧要，而且也不一定必须是机密的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 而且， 再者， 此外
detailed_translations.english: in addition – used to introduce information that adds to or supports what has previously been said

name: scatter
trans: 撒， 散播； 使散开， 驱散 (vt.)

sentences.english: The sound of gunfire made the crowd scatter in all directions.
sentences.chinese: 枪声使人群四散奔逃。

detailed_translations.chinese: 撒， 散播； 使散开， 驱散
detailed_translations.english: if someone scatters a lot of things, or if they scatter, they are thrown or dropped over a wide area in an irregular way

name: violate
trans: 违反， 违背； 亵渎； 侵犯， 妨碍 (vt.)

sentences.english: 34 protesters were arrested for violating criminal law.
sentences.chinese: 34名抗议者因违反刑法而被逮捕。

sentences.english: regimes that violate human rights
sentences.chinese: 侵犯人权的政权

detailed_translations.chinese: 违反， 违背； 亵渎； 侵犯， 妨碍
detailed_translations.english: to disobey or do something against an official agreement, law, principle etc

name: federal
trans: 联邦的， 联盟的 (adj.)

sentences.english: Switzerland is a federal republic.
sentences.chinese: 瑞士是一个联邦共和国。

detailed_translations.chinese: 联邦的， 联盟的
detailed_translations.english: a federal country or system of government consists of a group of states which control their own affairs, but which are also controlled by a single national government which makes decisions on foreign affairs, defence etc

name: verify
trans: 证实， 查证， 证明 (vt.)

sentences.english: His statement was verified by several witnesses.
sentences.chinese: 他的说法得到了几位证人的证实。

detailed_translations.chinese: 证实， 查证， 证明
detailed_translations.english: to state that something is true

name: excursion
trans: 远足， 短途旅行 (n.)

sentences.english: a shopping excursion
sentences.chinese: 购物游

detailed_translations.chinese: 远足， 短途旅行
detailed_translations.english: a short journey arranged so that a group of people can visit a place, especially while they are on holiday

name: inaugurate
trans: 开始， 开展； 为…举行就职典礼； 为…举行开幕式， 为…举行落成仪式 (vt.)

sentences.english: The Turner Prize was inaugurated in 1984.
sentences.chinese: 特纳奖于1984年正式设立。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开始， 开展； 为…举行就职典礼； 为…举行开幕式， 为…举行落成仪式
detailed_translations.english: to hold an official ceremony when someone starts doing an important job in government

name: undergo
trans: 经历； 经受， 忍受 (vt.)

sentences.english: The country has undergone massive changes recently.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家最近经历了巨大的变化。

sentences.english: He has been released from prison to undergo medical treatment in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 他获释出狱去美国接受治疗。

sentences.english: She has been undergoing tests since Monday.
sentences.chinese: 她从星期一开始一直在接受各种检查。

sentences.english: Teachers should be expected to undergo mid-career training and development.
sentences.chinese: 教师应该参加中期职业培训和发展活动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 经历； 经受， 忍受
detailed_translations.english: if you undergo a change, an unpleasant experience etc, it happens to you or is done to you

name: reward
trans: 报答，奖赏；报酬，酬金 (n.)
报答， 酬谢， 奖励 (vt.)

sentences.english: The school has a system of rewards and punishments to encourage good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 学校有奖惩制度以鼓励良好行为。

detailed_translations.chinese: 报答，奖赏；报酬，酬金
detailed_translations.english: something that you get because you have done something good or helpful or have worked hard

detailed_translations.chinese: 报答， 酬谢， 奖励
detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone because they have done something good or helpful or have worked for it

name: graze
trans: 吃青草 (vi.)
放牧；擦伤；擦过，掠过 (vt.)
擦破 (n.)

sentences.english: fields where they used to graze their sheep
sentences.chinese: 他们过去放羊的田野

detailed_translations.chinese: 吃青草
detailed_translations.english: if an animal grazes, or if you graze it, it eats grass that is growing

detailed_translations.chinese: 放牧；擦伤；擦过，掠过
detailed_translations.english: to accidentally break the surface of your skin by rubbing it against something

detailed_translations.chinese: 擦破
detailed_translations.english: a wound caused by rubbing that slightly breaks the surface of your skin

name: coupon
trans: 礼券， 优惠券； 配给券， 票证 (n.)

sentences.english: The coupon entitles you to ten cents off your next purchase.
sentences.chinese: 这张优惠券可以让你在下次购物时节省10分钱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 礼券， 优惠券； 配给券， 票证
detailed_translations.english: a small piece of printed paper that gives you the right to pay less for something or get something free

name: multitude
trans: 大量， 许多； 大众， 民众 (n.)

sentences.english: Political power has been placed in the hands of the multitude.
sentences.chinese: 政治权力已交到民众手中。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大量， 许多； 大众， 民众
detailed_translations.english: ordinary people, especially when they are thought of as not being very well educated

name: inhabit
trans: 居住于， 栖居于 (vt.)

sentences.english: The woods are inhabited by many wild animals.
sentences.chinese: 很多野生动物栖居在这片森林里。

sentences.english: inhabited islands
sentences.chinese: 有人居住的岛屿

detailed_translations.chinese: 居住于， 栖居于
detailed_translations.english: if animals or people inhabit an area or place, they live there

name: siege
trans: 包围， 围困 (n.)

sentences.english: The siege lasted almost four months.
sentences.chinese: 这次封锁历时近四个月。

sentences.english: a three-day police siege at a remote country cottage
sentences.chinese: 警方对一座偏僻村舍历时三天的包围

detailed_translations.chinese: 包围， 围困
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which an army or the police surround a place and try to gain control of it or force someone to come out of it

name: abstract
trans: 抽象的，抽象派的 (adj.)
摘要，梗概；抽象派艺术作品 (n.)

sentences.english: By the age of seven, children are capable of thinking in abstract terms .
sentences.chinese: 儿童到了七岁就具有抽象思维的能力。

sentences.english: Human beings are the only creatures capable of abstract thought (=  thinking about ideas  ) .
sentences.chinese: 人类是唯一具有抽象思维能力的动物。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抽象的，抽象派的
detailed_translations.english: based on general ideas or principles rather than specific examples or real events

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要，梗概；抽象派艺术作品
detailed_translations.english: a painting, design etc which contains shapes or images that do not look like real things or people

name: agenda
trans: 议程 (n.)

sentences.english: The Republicans have stuck to their conservative agenda.
sentences.chinese: 共和党人坚持自己的保守议题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 议程
detailed_translations.english: a list of problems or subjects that a government, organization etc is planning to deal with

name: degenerate
trans: 衰退，堕落，蜕化 (vi.)
衰退的，堕落的 (adj.)
堕落者 (n.)

sentences.english: Inactivity can make your joints stiff, and the bones may begin to degenerate.
sentences.chinese: 不活动会使关节僵硬，骨骼因此可能会开始退化。

detailed_translations.chinese: 衰退，堕落，蜕化
detailed_translations.english: to become worse

detailed_translations.chinese: 衰退的，堕落的
detailed_translations.english: morally unacceptable

detailed_translations.chinese: 堕落者
detailed_translations.english: someone whose behaviour is considered to be morally unacceptable

name: nurture
trans: 养育， 培育， 滋养 (n&vt.)

sentences.english: plants nurtured in the greenhouse
sentences.chinese: 在温室里培育的植物

detailed_translations.chinese: 养育， 培育， 滋养
detailed_translations.english: to feed and take care of a child or a plant while it is growing

name: destructive
trans: 破坏的， 毁灭的 (adj.)

sentences.english: the destructive power of modern weapons
sentences.chinese: 现代武器的破坏力

detailed_translations.chinese: 破坏的， 毁灭的
detailed_translations.english: causing damage to people or things

name: appearance
trans: 出现， 来到； 外观 (n.)

sentences.english: He was always criticising his wife’s appearance.
sentences.chinese: 他老是批评妻子的外表。

sentences.english: We are often attracted to somebody first by their physical appearance .
sentences.chinese: 我们经常先被一个人的外貌吸引。

sentences.english: Women, in general, tend to be more concerned than men about their personal appearance .
sentences.chinese: 总的来说，女性比男性更注重自己的仪容。

sentences.english: She had an outward appearance of calm, but deep down she was really worried.
sentences.chinese: 她表面上很镇静，内心却十分担忧。

sentences.english: The metal posts spoiled the appearance of the garden.
sentences.chinese: 金属柱子破坏了花园的外观。

sentences.english: A garnish helps to enhance the appearance of any dish.
sentences.chinese: 装饰菜能为任何菜肴增色。

sentences.english: She’s the kind of woman who takes pride in her appearance .
sentences.chinese: 她是那种对自己的外貌感到自豪的女人。

sentences.english: You shouldn’t judge by appearances .
sentences.chinese: 你不该以貌取人。

sentences.english: They work hard at school without giving the appearance of being particularly hard-working.
sentences.chinese: 他们在学校里学习很用功，只是表面上并不显得特别如此。

sentences.english: The case had all the appearances of a straightforward murder.
sentences.chinese: 从所有迹象来看，这个案件都像一宗简单的谋杀。

sentences.english: The pupils looked angelic – but appearances can be deceptive .
sentences.chinese: 这些学生看上去如天使一般，但外表可能是会骗人的。

sentences.english: He was, to all appearances , a respectable, successful businessman.
sentences.chinese: 从各方面看，他都是个体面而成功的商人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 出现， 来到； 外观
detailed_translations.english: the way someone or something looks to other people

name: culture
trans: 文化， 文明； 教养； 培养； 培养菌 (n.)

sentences.english: We speak Danish at home so that the boys don’t lose touch with their language and culture.
sentences.chinese: 我们在家说丹麦语，这样男孩子们就不会脱离他们的语言和文化。

sentences.english: In our culture, it is rude to ask someone how much they earn.
sentences.chinese: 在我们的文化里，问别人收入多少是不礼貌的。

sentences.english: I love working abroad and meeting people from diffe-rent cultures.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢在国外工作，认识来自不同文化的人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 文化， 文明； 教养； 培养； 培养菌
detailed_translations.english: the beliefs, way of life, art, and customs that are shared and accepted by people in a particular society

name: paternity
trans: 父权， 父子关系 (n.)

sentences.english: The paternity of the child is in dispute.
sentences.chinese: 这个孩子的生父是谁尚有疑问。

detailed_translations.chinese: 父权， 父子关系

name: hasty
trans: 草率的， 轻率的； 急速的， 匆忙的， 仓促完成的 (adj.)

sentences.english: He soon regretted his hasty decision.
sentences.chinese: 他很快就对自己仓促作出的决定感到后悔了。

sentences.english: a hasty breakfast
sentences.chinese: 匆忙吃下的一顿早餐

detailed_translations.chinese: 草率的， 轻率的； 急速的， 匆忙的， 仓促完成的
detailed_translations.english: done in a hurry, especially with bad results

name: anonymous
trans: 无名的， 不具名的； 匿名的； 无特色的， 无个性特征的 (adj.)

sentences.english: the anonymous author of a collection of poems
sentences.chinese: 一本诗集的佚名作者

sentences.english: According to one employee, who wishes to remain anonymous , the company engaged in illegal activities.
sentences.chinese: 根据一位不愿透露姓名的员工所述，这家公司曾从事非法活动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无名的， 不具名的； 匿名的； 无特色的， 无个性特征的
detailed_translations.english: unknown by name

name: fake
trans: 假的，伪造的 (adj.)
假货；骗子 (n.)
伪造， 捏造； 伪装 (vt.)

sentences.english: fake fur
sentences.chinese: 人造毛皮

sentences.english: a fake ID card
sentences.chinese: 假身份证

sentences.english: a fake 20 dollar bill
sentences.chinese: 一张20美元的伪钞

detailed_translations.chinese: 假的，伪造的
detailed_translations.english: made to look like a real material or object in order to deceive people

detailed_translations.chinese: 假货；骗子
detailed_translations.english: a copy of a valuable object, painting etc that is intended to deceive people

detailed_translations.chinese: 伪造， 捏造； 伪装
detailed_translations.english: to make something seem real in order to deceive people

name: span
trans: 跨距，一段时间 (n.)
持续， 贯穿， 包括； 横跨， 跨越 (vt.)

sentences.english: It’ll be difficult to hire that many new staff in such a short time span .
sentences.chinese: 在这么短的时间里要想招聘到那么多新员工是很难的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 跨距，一段时间
detailed_translations.english: a period of time between two dates or events

detailed_translations.chinese: 持续， 贯穿， 包括； 横跨， 跨越
detailed_translations.english: to include all of a period of time

name: escort
trans: 护卫者，护送者 (n.)
护送， 护卫 (vt.)

sentences.english: a police escort
sentences.chinese: 警察护卫队

detailed_translations.chinese: 护卫者，护送者
detailed_translations.english: a person or a group of people or vehicles that go with someone in order to protect or guard them

detailed_translations.chinese: 护送， 护卫
detailed_translations.english: to take someone somewhere, especially when you are protecting or guarding them

name: bizarre
trans: 奇形怪状的， 怪诞的 (adj.)

sentences.english: a bizarre coincidence
sentences.chinese: 奇怪的巧合

sentences.english: dancers in rather bizarre costumes
sentences.chinese: 身着奇装异服的舞者

detailed_translations.chinese: 奇形怪状的， 怪诞的
detailed_translations.english: very unusual or strange

name: existence
trans: 存在， 实在； 生存 (n.)

sentences.english: Scientists have many theories about how the universe first came into existence (= started to exist ).
sentences.chinese: 关于宇宙的起源，科学家有多种理论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 存在， 实在； 生存
detailed_translations.english: the state of existing

name: ascribe
trans: 把…归因于， 把…归属于 (vt.)

sentences.english: An autopsy eventually ascribed the baby's death to sudden infant death syndrome.
sentences.chinese: 一次尸检最终把这名婴儿的死亡归因于婴儿猝死综合症。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…归因于， 把…归属于
detailed_translations.english: If you ascribe an event or condition to a particular cause, you say or consider that it was caused by that thing

name: threshold
trans: 门槛， 门口； 入门， 开端， 起始点 (n.)

sentences.english: She opened the door and stepped across the threshold.
sentences.chinese: 她打开门，跨过门槛。

detailed_translations.chinese: 门槛， 门口； 入门， 开端， 起始点
detailed_translations.english: the entrance to a room or building, or the area of floor or ground at the entrance

name: float
trans: 浮动， 漂浮， 飘动 (v.)

sentences.english: I looked up at the clouds floating in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 我仰望着天上的浮云。

sentences.english: Leaves floated gently down from the trees.
sentences.chinese: 叶子从树上轻轻飘落。

detailed_translations.chinese: 浮动， 漂浮， 飘动
detailed_translations.english: if something floats, it moves slowly through the air or stays up in the air

name: minority
trans: 少数； 少数民族 (n.)

sentences.english: Gaelic is still spoken in Ireland by a tiny minority.
sentences.chinese: 爱尔兰仍有极少数人在说盖尔语。

detailed_translations.chinese: 少数； 少数民族
detailed_translations.english: a small group of people or things within a much larger group

name: axis
trans: 轴， 轴线， 中心线； 坐标轴， 基准线 (n.)

sentences.english: The Earth rotates on an axis between the north and south poles.
sentences.chinese: 地球绕着南北两极之间的地轴自转。

detailed_translations.chinese: 轴， 轴线， 中心线； 坐标轴， 基准线
detailed_translations.english: the imaginary line around which a large round object, such as the Earth, turns

name: pole
trans: 杆； 极， 磁极， 电极 (n.)

sentences.english: a telephone pole
sentences.chinese: 电话线杆

detailed_translations.chinese: 杆； 极， 磁极， 电极
detailed_translations.english: one of two points at the ends of a  magnet  where its power is the strongest

name: preferable
trans: 更可取的， 更好的， 更合意的 (adj.)

sentences.english: For this dish, fresh herbs and garlic are preferable.
sentences.chinese: 做这道菜，用新鲜香草和大蒜更好。

sentences.english: In warm weather, clothes made of natural fabrics are infinitely preferable (= much better ) .
sentences.chinese: 天气暖和的时候，穿天然织物的衣服要舒适得多。

detailed_translations.chinese: 更可取的， 更好的， 更合意的
detailed_translations.english: better or more suitable

name: reference
trans: 提到， 论及； 参考， 查阅； 引文； 参考书目； 证明书， 推荐信 (n.)

sentences.english: Keep their price list on file for future reference (= so that it can be looked at in the future ) .
sentences.chinese: 将他们的价目表存档，以供日后参考。

detailed_translations.chinese: 提到， 论及； 参考， 查阅； 引文； 参考书目； 证明书， 推荐信
detailed_translations.english: part of something you say or write in which you mention a person or thing

name: spite
trans: 恶意，怨恨；不顾 (n.)
刁难， 欺侮 (vt.)

sentences.english: We went out in spite of the rain.

name: trial

name: perception
trans: 感知， 觉察； 认识， 观念， 看法 (n.)

trans: 想象； 设想 (vt.)

detailed_translations.chinese: 昆虫， 虫

name: presume
trans: 擅自行事 (vi.)
推测，假定，相信；冒昧，擅自；认定，推定 (vt.)

sentences.chinese: “他整个星期都在家吗？”—“我想是。”

name: rot

name: volunteer
trans: 自愿； 自愿提供； 志愿 (v.)
志愿者；志愿兵 (n.)

sentences.english: I volunteered my services as a driver.
sentences.chinese: 我主动提出来当司机。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自愿； 自愿提供； 志愿
detailed_translations.english: to offer to do something without expecting any reward, often something that other people do not want to do

detailed_translations.chinese: 志愿者；志愿兵
detailed_translations.english: someone who does a job willingly without being paid

name: overlap
trans: 部分重叠； 部分相同 (v.)
重叠， 重叠的部分 (n.)

sentences.english: When the bag is folded, the bottom overlaps one side.
sentences.chinese: 把包折叠起来时，其底部与一边就重合了。

sentences.english: Overlap the slices carefully so there are no gaps.
sentences.chinese: 把薄片小心地叠放在一起，那样就没有间隙。

detailed_translations.chinese: 部分重叠； 部分相同
detailed_translations.english: If one thing overlaps another, or if you overlap them, a part of the first thing occupies the same area as a part of the other thing. You can also say that two things overlap.

detailed_translations.chinese: 重叠， 重叠的部分
detailed_translations.english: the amount by which two activities, ideas, things etc overlap

name: materialism
trans: 唯物主义 (n.)

sentences.english: a reaction to a world full of shallow materialism
sentences.chinese: 对充满浅薄的物质主义思想的世界作出的回应

detailed_translations.chinese: 唯物主义
detailed_translations.english: the belief that money and possessions are more important than art, religion, moral beliefs etc – used in order to show disapproval

name: installment
trans: 分期付款， 分期交付； 部分 (n.)

sentences.english: Now she can reduce the installment size that she can afford to pay, by extending the loan period.
sentences.chinese: 现在，她就可通过展延贷款周期来减小自己有能力支付的分期付款的规模。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分期付款， 分期交付； 部分

name: mourn
trans: 哀悼； 感到痛心 (v.)

sentences.english: Hundreds of people gathered to mourn the slain president.
sentences.chinese: 成百上千人聚集在一起悼念遇刺的总统。

detailed_translations.chinese: 哀悼； 感到痛心
detailed_translations.english: to feel very sad and to miss someone after they have died

name: cane
trans: 手杖； 茎 (n.)

sentences.english: ...cane furniture.
sentences.chinese: …藤制家具。

detailed_translations.chinese: 手杖； 茎
detailed_translations.english: a long thin stick with a curved handle that you can use to help you walk

name: trifle
trans: 嘲笑； 轻视 (vi.)
琐事，小事，无价值的东西 (n.)

sentences.english: There’s no point in arguing over trifles.
sentences.chinese: 为琐事争吵毫无意义。

detailed_translations.chinese: 嘲笑； 轻视
琐事，小事，无价值的东西
detailed_translations.english: something unimportant or not valuable

name: migrate
trans: 迁徙， 移栖； 移居， 迁移 (vi.)

sentences.english: People migrate to cities like Jakarta in search of work.
sentences.chinese: 人们移居到雅加达这样的城市找工作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 迁徙， 移栖； 移居， 迁移
detailed_translations.english: if birds or animals migrate, they travel regularly from one part of the world to another

name: Easter
trans: 复活节 (n.)

sentences.english: on Easter Sunday
sentences.chinese: 在复活节星期日

detailed_translations.chinese: 复活节
detailed_translations.english: a Christian holy day in March or April when Christians remember the death of Christ and his return to life

name: submit
trans: 屈从， 听从； 忍受； 甘心 (vi.)
屈从，听从，服从；呈送，提交；主张，建议 (vt.)

sentences.english: In desperation, Mrs. Jones submitted to an operation on her right knee to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 绝望中，琼斯夫人不得已接受了一次她右膝的手术以减轻疼痛。

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从， 听从； 忍受； 甘心
detailed_translations.english: If you submit to something, you unwillingly allow something to be done to you, or you do what someone wants, for example because you are not powerful enough to resist

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从，听从，服从；呈送，提交；主张，建议
detailed_translations.english: to give a plan, piece of writing etc to someone in authority for them to consider or approve

name: novelty
trans: 新奇事物； 新奇， 新奇感， 新奇性； 新颖小巧而廉价的物品 (n.)

sentences.english: Many toys have no attraction beyond their novelty value.
sentences.chinese: 许多玩具除了有些新奇感之外，别无吸引力。

sentences.english: It was fun for a while, but the novelty wore off (= it became boring ).
sentences.chinese: 开始有一阵很好玩，可是新鲜感随后便消失了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 新奇事物； 新奇， 新奇感， 新奇性； 新颖小巧而廉价的物品
detailed_translations.english: the quality of being new, unusual, and interesting

name: occupy
trans: 占领； 占； 占有 (vt.)

sentences.english: Football occupies most of my leisure time.
sentences.chinese: 足球占去了我大部分的闲暇时间。

detailed_translations.chinese: 占领； 占； 占有
detailed_translations.english: if something occupies you or your time, you are busy doing it

name: string
trans: 线， 细绳； 一串， 一行 (n.)

sentences.english: Her key hung on a string around her neck.
sentences.chinese: 她的钥匙穿了根绳子挂在脖子上。

sentences.english: a ball of string
sentences.chinese: 一团细绳

sentences.english: I need a piece of string to tie this package.
sentences.chinese: 我需要一根绳子来捆这个包裹。

detailed_translations.chinese: 线， 细绳； 一串， 一行
detailed_translations.english: a strong thread made of several threads twisted together, used for tying or fastening things

name: boom
trans: 激增， 繁荣， 迅速发展； 发出隆隆声 (vi.)
激增，繁荣，迅速发展；隆隆声，嗡嗡声 (n.)

sentences.english: Business was booming , and money wasn’t a problem.
sentences.chinese: 生意非常兴隆，钱已不是问题。

sentences.english: Tourism on the island has boomed.
sentences.chinese: 岛上的旅游业迅速发展。

detailed_translations.chinese: 激增， 繁荣， 迅速发展； 发出隆隆声
detailed_translations.english: if business, trade, or a particular area is booming, it is increasing and being very successful

detailed_translations.chinese: 激增，繁荣，迅速发展；隆隆声，嗡嗡声
detailed_translations.english: a quick increase of business activity

name: absence
trans: 缺席， 不在； 缺席的时间， 外出期； 缺乏， 不存在 (n.)

sentences.english: In the absence of any evidence, the police had to let Myers go.
sentences.chinese: 警察没有证据，只好把迈尔斯放了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺席， 不在； 缺席的时间， 外出期； 缺乏， 不存在
detailed_translations.english: when you are not in the place where people expect you to be, or the time that you are away

name: abolish
trans: 彻底废除， 废止 (vt.)

sentences.english: Slavery was abolished in the US in the 19th century.
sentences.chinese: 美国于19世纪废除了奴隶制。

detailed_translations.chinese: 彻底废除， 废止
detailed_translations.english: to officially end a law, system etc, especially one that has existed for a long time

name: attract
trans: 吸引， 引起…注意 (vt.)

sentences.english: I’m not usually attracted to blondes.
sentences.chinese: 我一般不喜欢金发女子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 吸引， 引起…注意
detailed_translations.english: to make someone interested in something, or make them want to take part in something

name: cautious
trans: 十分小心的， 谨慎的 (adj.)

sentences.english: a cautious driver
sentences.chinese: 一位谨慎的司机

sentences.english: a cautious approach to the crisis
sentences.chinese: 处理危机的谨慎态度

sentences.english: The air-pollution board has reacted with cautious optimism to the announcement.
sentences.chinese: 空气污染委员会对这项通告表示谨慎乐观。

detailed_translations.chinese: 十分小心的， 谨慎的
detailed_translations.english: careful to avoid danger or risks

name: snatch
trans: 一把抓住 (vi.)
夺，夺走，抢走；一下子拉，一把抓住；抓住机会做，抽空做 (vt.)
片断 (n.)

sentences.english: I snatched a glance at the mirror.
sentences.chinese: 我乘机瞥了一眼镜子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一把抓住
detailed_translations.english: If you snatch an opportunity, you take it quickly. If you snatch something to eat or a rest, you have it quickly in between doing other things.

detailed_translations.chinese: 夺，夺走，抢走；一下子拉，一把抓住；抓住机会做，抽空做
detailed_translations.english: to take something away from someone with a quick, often violent, movement

detailed_translations.chinese: 片断
detailed_translations.english: a short part of a conversation, song etc that you hear

name: blink
trans: 眨眼睛；闪亮，闪烁 (vi.)
眨眼睛； 一瞬间 (n.)

sentences.english: I blinked as I came out into the sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 我走出来，在太阳光下直眨眼睛。

detailed_translations.chinese: 眨眼睛；闪亮，闪烁
detailed_translations.english: to shut and open your eyes quickly

detailed_translations.chinese: 眨眼睛； 一瞬间
detailed_translations.english: very quickly

name: summit
trans: 最高点， 峰顶； 最高级会议 (n.)

sentences.english: the European summit
sentences.chinese: 欧洲首脑会议

sentences.english: The two presidents agreed to hold a summit in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 两位总统商定在春天举行一次首脑会议。

sentences.english: a five-nation summit meeting
sentences.chinese: 五国峰会

detailed_translations.chinese: 最高点， 峰顶； 最高级会议
detailed_translations.english: an important meeting or set of meetings between the leaders of several governments

name: perfume
trans: 香水，香料，香气 (n.)
使充满芳香； 洒香水于 (vt.)

sentences.english: She was wearing the perfume that he’d bought her.
sentences.chinese: 她擦了他买给她的香水。

detailed_translations.chinese: 香水，香料，香气
detailed_translations.english: a liquid with a strong pleasant smell that women put on their skin or clothing to make themselves smell nice

detailed_translations.chinese: 使充满芳香； 洒香水于
detailed_translations.english: to make a place have a sweet pleasant smell

name: magnify
trans: 放大， 扩大； 夸大， 夸张 (vt.)

sentences.english: At the Sheffield arena, the speakers were magnified ten times on a giant screen.
sentences.chinese: 在谢菲尔德体育馆，演讲者在一个巨大的屏幕上被放大了十倍。

sentences.english: A public address system magnifies all the little noises and coughs.
sentences.chinese: 扩音系统会放大任何细小的噪音和咳嗽声。

detailed_translations.chinese: 放大， 扩大； 夸大， 夸张
detailed_translations.english: to make something seem bigger or louder, especially using special equipment

name: redundant
trans: 多余的， 过剩的 (adj.)

sentences.english: the removal of redundant information
sentences.chinese: 多余信息的删除

detailed_translations.chinese: 多余的， 过剩的
detailed_translations.english: not necessary because something else means or does the same thing

name: situated
trans: 位于…的， 坐落在…的； 处于…境地的 (adj.)

sentences.english: His hotel is situated in one of the loveliest places on the Loire.
sentences.chinese: 他的旅馆坐落在卢瓦尔的一个最优美的地方。

detailed_translations.chinese: 位于…的， 坐落在…的； 处于…境地的
detailed_translations.english: to be in a particular place or position

name: recession
trans: 衰退， 衰退期 (n.)

sentences.english: the economic recession of the early 1980s
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代初的经济衰退

sentences.english: There is deep recession in the UK.
sentences.chinese: 英国处于严重的经济衰退之中。

detailed_translations.chinese: 衰退， 衰退期
detailed_translations.english: a difficult time when there is less trade, business activity etc in a country than usual

name: doubtless
trans: 无疑地， 肯定地 (adv.)

sentences.english: Doubtless there would be lots of rumours.
sentences.chinese: 无疑会谣言四起。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无疑地， 肯定地
detailed_translations.english: used when saying that something is almost certain to happen or be true

name: negative
trans: 否定的，消极的；负的，阴性的 (adj.)
负片， 底片； 负数 (n.)

sentences.english: students with a negative attitude to school
sentences.chinese: 对上学抱消极态度的学生

sentences.english: They have a uniformly negative image of the police.
sentences.chinese: 他们都对警察印象不好。

sentences.english: Jean rarely sounded so negative about her mother.
sentences.chinese: 琼很少这么说她母亲不好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 否定的，消极的；负的，阴性的
detailed_translations.english: considering only the bad qualities of a situation, person etc and not the good ones

detailed_translations.chinese: 负片， 底片； 负数
detailed_translations.english: an image on a photographic film that shows dark areas as light and light areas as dark, from which the final picture is printed

name: impose
trans: 把…强加； 征 (vt.)

sentences.english: Parents should beware of imposing their own tastes on their children.
sentences.chinese: 父母应该提防把自己的兴趣强加给孩子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…强加； 征
detailed_translations.english: If you impose your opinions or beliefs on other people, you try and make people accept them as a rule or as a model to copy

name: statement
trans: 陈述， 声明； 结算单， 报表 (n.)

sentences.english: In an official statement, she formally announced her resignation.
sentences.chinese: 在一份官方声明中，她正式宣布辞职。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陈述， 声明； 结算单， 报表
detailed_translations.english: something you say or write, especially publicly or officially, to let people know your intentions or opinions, or to record facts

name: trademark
trans: 商标， 牌号； 特征， 标记 (n.)

sentences.english: The striped T-shirt became the comedian’s trademark.
sentences.chinese: 条纹T恤衫成了这位喜剧演员的标记。

detailed_translations.chinese: 商标， 牌号； 特征， 标记
detailed_translations.english: a special name, sign, or word that is marked on a product to show that it is made by a particular company, that cannot be used by any other company

name: factor
trans: 因素， 因子； 系数 (n.)

sentences.english: The rise in crime is mainly due to social and economic factors.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪率上升主要由社会和经济因素造成。

detailed_translations.chinese: 因素， 因子； 系数
detailed_translations.english: one of several things that influence or cause a situation

name: analogous
trans: 类似的， 相似的； 可比拟的 (adj.)

sentences.english: Marine construction technology like this is very complex, somewhat analogous to trying to build a bridge under water.
sentences.chinese: 像这样的海洋建筑技术非常复杂，有些类似于尝试在水下建筑一座桥。

detailed_translations.chinese: 类似的， 相似的； 可比拟的
detailed_translations.english: similar to another situation or thing so that a comparison can be made

name: substance
trans: 物质； 实质； 大意， 要旨； 根据， 理由 (n.)

sentences.english: The leaves were covered with a strange sticky substance.
sentences.chinese: 树叶上覆着一层黏糊糊的怪东西。

detailed_translations.chinese: 物质； 实质； 大意， 要旨； 根据， 理由
detailed_translations.english: a particular type of solid, liquid, or gas

name: complexion
trans: 肤色， 面色； 局面； 性质 (n.)

sentences.english: Drinking water is good for the complexion.
sentences.chinese: 喝水让气色变好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 肤色， 面色； 局面； 性质
detailed_translations.english: the natural colour or appearance of the skin on your face

name: continuity
trans: 连续， 持续 (n.)

sentences.english: We should ensure continuity of care between hospital and home.
sentences.chinese: 我们应当保证医院护理和家庭护理的连续性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 连续， 持续
detailed_translations.english: the state of continuing for a period of time, without problems, interruptions, or changes

name: sculpture
trans: 雕刻， 雕塑； 雕刻作品， 雕塑品 (n.)

sentences.english: ...stone sculptures of figures and animals.
sentences.chinese: …人物及动物石雕。

detailed_translations.chinese: 雕刻， 雕塑； 雕刻作品， 雕塑品
detailed_translations.english: an object made out of stone, wood, clay etc by an artist

name: target
trans: 靶， 标的， 目标 (n.)

sentences.english: There is no target date for completion of the new project.
sentences.chinese: 这个新的项目何时完工没有预定日期。

sentences.english: The government may fail to meet (= achieve ) its target of recycling 25% of domestic waste.
sentences.chinese: 政府可能达不到回收利用25%的生活垃圾的目标。

sentences.english: Jiang set annual growth targets of 8–9%.
sentences.chinese: 江确定了8%至9%的年增长目标。

detailed_translations.chinese: 靶， 标的， 目标
detailed_translations.english: something that you are trying to achieve, such as a total, an amount, or a time

name: momentum
trans: 动力， 冲力， 势头； 动量 (n.)

sentences.english: incentives to maintain the momentum of European integration
sentences.chinese: 保持欧洲一体化发展势头的激励措施

sentences.english: Governments often lose momentum in their second term of office.
sentences.chinese: 政府往往会在第二届任期中丧失冲劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 动力， 冲力， 势头； 动量
detailed_translations.english: the ability to keep increasing, developing, or being more successful

name: wax
trans: 蜡，蜂蜡 (n.)
给…上蜡 (vt.)

sentences.english: wax crayons
sentences.chinese: 蜡笔

detailed_translations.chinese: 蜡，蜂蜡
detailed_translations.english: a solid substance made of fat or oil and used to make candles, polish etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 给…上蜡
detailed_translations.english: to rub a layer of wax into a floor, surface etc to protect it or make it shine

name: sensation
trans: 感觉能力； 感觉， 知觉； 轰动， 引起轰动的事件 (n.)

sentences.english: Jerry realized that he had no sensation in his legs.
sentences.chinese: 杰里意识到自己双腿都没有了知觉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感觉能力； 感觉， 知觉； 轰动， 引起轰动的事件
detailed_translations.english: a feeling that is difficult to describe, caused by a particular event, experience, or memory

name: urban
trans: 都市的， 住在都市的 (adj.)

sentences.english: unemployment in urban areas
sentences.chinese: 城市地区的失业状况

sentences.english: the deprived sections of the urban population
sentences.chinese: 城市人口中的贫困群体

detailed_translations.chinese: 都市的， 住在都市的
detailed_translations.english: relating to towns and cities

name: furthermore
trans: 而且， 此外 (adv.)

sentences.english: He is old and unpopular. Furthermore, he has at best only two years of political life ahead of him.
sentences.chinese: 他年纪已老，又不得人心，而且他最多也只有两年的政治生命了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 而且， 此外
detailed_translations.english: in addition to what has already been said

name: timely
trans: 及时的， 适时的 (adj.)

sentences.english: The fight ended only with the timely arrival of the police.
sentences.chinese: 幸亏警察及时赶到，打斗总算停止。

detailed_translations.chinese: 及时的， 适时的
detailed_translations.english: done or happening at exactly the right time

name: cape
trans: 斗篷， 披肩； 海角， 岬 (n.)

sentences.english: Cape Cod
sentences.chinese: 科德角

detailed_translations.chinese: 斗篷， 披肩； 海角， 岬
detailed_translations.english: a long loose piece of clothing without  sleeve s  that fastens around your neck and hangs from your shoulders

name: discard
trans: 丢弃， 抛弃， 遗弃 (vt.)

sentences.english: Read the manufacturer's guidelines before discarding the box.
sentences.chinese: 先阅读制造商的说明书再把盒子丢掉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 丢弃， 抛弃， 遗弃
detailed_translations.english: If you discard something, you get rid of it because you no longer want it or need it

name: delicate
trans: 纤细的； 易碎的； 微妙的； 精美的 (adj.)

sentences.english: delicate hand-cut glass
sentences.chinese: 易碎的手工刻花玻璃

sentences.english: The sun can easily damage a child’s delicate skin .
sentences.chinese: 阳光很容易晒伤小孩娇嫩的皮肤。

detailed_translations.chinese: 纤细的； 易碎的； 微妙的； 精美的
detailed_translations.english: easily damaged or broken

name: rebel
trans: 反叛， 造反； 反对， 不服从 (vi.)
反叛分子，反对者 (n.)

sentences.english: Voters rebelled against high property taxes.
sentences.chinese: 投票者们反对高额财产税。

detailed_translations.chinese: 反叛， 造反； 反对， 不服从

sentences.chinese: 像贪食症和厌食症这类严重的进食障碍

sentences.chinese: 政府的经济政策

sentences.chinese: 经济改革势在必行。

sentences.chinese: 每个晶体管至少有三个电极。

sentences.chinese: 晶体管后来成为了一项叫做“计算机”的新发明的基础，我想正在阅读本文的你对于这个应该比较熟悉吧。

sentences.english: When you got a transistor radio, you could walk around with it, and today you can put your whole record collection in your pocket.
sentences.chinese: 而当你使用晶体管收音机时，你可以带着它到处走动，时至今日你可以把你收集的唱片装进口袋里。

阴谋， 诡计， 密谋 (n.)

name: orient
trans: 转向特定方向；适应[theO-] (vi.)
使适应，使熟悉情况；使朝向，以…为方向 (vt.)
东方， 亚洲， 东半球 (n.)

sentences.english: You will need the time to orient yourself to your new way of eating.
sentences.chinese: 你需要时间适应新的吃法。

sentences.english: You will need the time to orient yourself to your new way of eating.
sentences.chinese: 你需要时间适应新的吃法。

detailed_translations.english: When you orient yourself to a new situation or course of action, you learn about it and prepare to deal with it

name: crisis
trans: 危机， 存亡之际； 关键阶段 (n.)

sentences.english: The country now faces an economic crisis .
sentences.chinese: 该国目前正面临一场经济危机。

sentences.english: The Prime Minister was criticized for the way in which he handled the crisis .
sentences.chinese: 首相处理危机的方式遭到了批评。

sentences.english: the current debt crisis
sentences.chinese: 当前的债务危机

sentences.english: a major political crisis
sentences.chinese: 重大的政治危机

sentences.english: I was relieved that we had averted yet another financial crisis .
sentences.chinese: 我如释重负，我们又避免了一场财政危机。

sentences.chinese: 石油公司因在20世纪70年代的石油危机中赚取了丰厚利润而受到严厉抨击。

sentences.english: The car industry is now in crisis .
sentences.chinese: 汽车工业现在正处于危机之中。

name: handicap

sentences.chinese: 不会讲这种语言的确是一个障碍。

name: sanction

detailed_translations.english: A juvenile is a child or young person who is not yet old enough to be regarded as an adult

name: force
trans: 强迫；用力推动，用力打开 (vt.)
军队， 兵力； 暴力， 武力； 力， 力气； 影响力， 效力 (n.)

trans: 同情的； 和谐的； 赞同的， 支持的； 合意的 (adj.)

sentences.english: We hope always to provide a friendly sympathetic ear (= someone willing to listen to someone else’s problems ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们希望总能做到友善地倾听。

trans: 分发， 分配， 分布 (n.)

detailed_translations.chinese: 分发， 分配， 分布

trans: 起源， 衍生 (vi.)
取得，得到；追溯…的起源或来由 (vt.)

sentences.english: The name Anastasia is derived from a Greek word meaning "of the resurrection."

detailed_translations.chinese: 容量； 能力； 能量； 才能； 身份， 地位
detailed_translations.english: someone’s ability to do something

trans: 应付， 处理 (vi.)

sentences.chinese: 有时候我觉得很难应付。

sentences.english: He coped quite well as manager while still captaining the team.
sentences.chinese: 他是球队的主教练，同时兼任队长，干得相当好。

trans: 无意中听到， 偷听到 (vt.)

trans: 猛冲，飞奔 (vi.)
投射 (vt.)
飞镖， 飞镖游戏； 急驰， 飞奔 (n.)

sentences.chinese: 吉尔冲上前把他从火边拉开。

sentences.chinese: 她狡猾地斜瞟了布莱威尔一眼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 猛冲，飞奔

detailed_translations.english: a small pointed object that is thrown or shot as a weapon, or one that is thrown in the game of darts

trans: 缺点， 瑕疵， 缺陷 (n.)

sentences.chinese: 水从洞里流进来，浸湿了地毯。

trans: 特征，特色；面貌；特写，专题节目；故事片 (n.)
突出； 由…主演 (vt.)

sentences.chinese: 气囊是大多数新车的标准配置。

sentences.english: Striped tails are a common feature of many animals.
sentences.chinese: 尾巴上有条纹是许多动物的共同特征。

sentences.chinese: 现代银行业的显著特征之一就是依赖电脑。

sentences.chinese: 唱到副歌时，每个人都跟着齐唱起来。

name: owe

sentences.chinese: 破坏程度之大让我大为震惊。

sentences.english: Large firms benefit from economies of scale (= ways of saving money because they are big ) .
sentences.chinese: 大公司从规模经济中得益。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大小，规模；等级，级别；天平，磅秤；比例；刻度，标度；鳞
detailed_translations.english: the size or level of something, or the amount that something is happening

detailed_translations.chinese: 攀登， 爬越
detailed_translations.english: to climb to the top of something that is high and difficult to climb

name: gigantic
trans: 巨大的， 庞大的 (adj.)

sentences.english: a gigantic skyscraper
sentences.chinese: 摩天大楼

detailed_translations.chinese: 巨大的， 庞大的
detailed_translations.english: extremely big

name: distinct
trans: 与其他不同的； 清楚的， 明确的 (adj.)

sentences.english: two entirely distinct languages
sentences.chinese: 两种完全不同的语言

detailed_translations.chinese: 与其他不同的； 清楚的， 明确的
detailed_translations.english: clearly different or belonging to a different type

name: vegetation
trans: 植物， 草木 (n.)

sentences.english: Lefkas has an abundance of lush green vegetation.
sentences.chinese: 莱夫卡斯有葱郁茂盛的植被。

detailed_translations.chinese: 植物， 草木
detailed_translations.english: plants in general

name: recovery
trans: 恢复， 痊愈； 追回， 寻回， 收复 (n.)

sentences.english: Hopes of economic recovery are fading.
sentences.chinese: 经济复苏的希望越来越渺茫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恢复， 痊愈； 追回， 寻回， 收复
detailed_translations.english: the process of getting better after an illness, injury etc

name: geology
trans: 地质学； 地质情况 (n.)

sentences.english: He was visiting professor of geology at the University of Georgia.
sentences.chinese: 他曾是佐治亚大学的地质学客座教授。

detailed_translations.chinese: 地质学； 地质情况
detailed_translations.english: the study of the rocks, soil etc that make up the Earth, and of the way they have changed since the Earth was formed

name: hoist
trans: 举起，升起，吊起 (vt.)
起重器械； 举起， 升起， 吊起 (n.)

sentences.english: The crew hurried to hoist the flag.
sentences.chinese: 船员们急忙把旗子升起来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 举起，升起，吊起
detailed_translations.english: to raise, lift, or pull something up, especially using ropes

detailed_translations.chinese: 起重器械； 举起， 升起， 吊起
detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment used for lifting heavy objects with ropes

name: aware
trans: 知道的， 意识到的 (adj.)

sentences.english: Mr Braley has been made aware of the need for absolute secrecy.
sentences.chinese: 布雷利先生被告知需要绝对保密。

sentences.english: As you are aware, a fee will be charged annually.
sentences.chinese: 正如你所知道的那样，每年都要收取一笔费用。

detailed_translations.chinese: 知道的， 意识到的
detailed_translations.english: if you are aware that a situation exists, you realize or know that it exists

name: quart
trans: 夸脱 (n.)

sentences.english: The guardian found a quarterly quart of quartz in the safeguard.
sentences.chinese: 监护人在安全装置内找到了四分之一夸脱石英。

sentences.english: The quarrelsome general quarreled about a quarter quart of oil in the headquarters.
sentences.chinese: 好争持的将军正在司令部为四分之一夸脱油而争持。

sentences.english: Use warm water and baking soda solution about a tablespoon (15ml) of baking soda to a quart (1 liter) of water. This both cleans and neutralizes odors. Rinse and wipe dry.
sentences.chinese: 使用温水和碳酸氢钠溶液，其配比为一大汤勺（15毫升）碳酸氢钠比一夸脱（1升）水。这会清洁并中和异味。用清水冲洗，擦干。

detailed_translations.chinese: 夸脱
detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring liquid, equal to two pints. In Britain this is 1.14 litres, and in the US it is 0.95 litres.

name: numerical
trans: 数字的； 用数字表示的； 数值的 (adj.)

sentences.english: a numerical code
sentences.chinese: 数字密码

sentences.english: The home team tried to utilize their numerical advantage (= the fact that they had more players than the other team ).
sentences.chinese: 主队试图利用他们在人数上的优势。

sentences.english: Make sure the files are organized in numerical order.
sentences.chinese: 务必把这些档案按数字顺序排列。

detailed_translations.chinese: 数字的； 用数字表示的； 数值的
detailed_translations.english: expressed or considered in numbers

name: limp
trans: 一瘸一拐地走，蹒跚 (vi.)
软弱的，无生气的，无精神的；软的，松沓的 (adj.)
跛行 (n.)

sentences.english: Moreno limped off the field with a foot injury.
sentences.chinese: 莫雷诺脚上受了伤，一瘸一拐地走出球场。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一瘸一拐地走，蹒跚
detailed_translations.english: to walk slowly and with difficulty because one leg is hurt or injured

detailed_translations.chinese: 软弱的，无生气的，无精神的；软的，松沓的
detailed_translations.english: not firm or strong

detailed_translations.chinese: 跛行
detailed_translations.english: the way someone walks when they are limping

name: security
trans: 安全， 保障； 抵押品； 证券 (n.)

sentences.english: Parenting is about giving your child security and love.
sentences.chinese: 养育儿女就是要给他们保护和爱。

sentences.english: Workers want greater job security (= not being in danger of losing your job ) .
sentences.chinese: 工人们希望有更多的工作保障。

sentences.english: This insurance plan offers your family financial security in the event of your death.
sentences.chinese: 这份保险能在你死后给你的家人提供经济保障。

detailed_translations.chinese: 安全， 保障； 抵押品； 证券
detailed_translations.english: protection from bad things that could happen to you

name: award
trans: 奖，奖品；判定 (n.)
授予， 给予； 判给， 裁定 (vt.)

sentences.english: The movie has won a number of awards.
sentences.chinese: 该片获得了多个奖项。

sentences.english: an award-winning restaurant
sentences.chinese: 获奖餐厅

detailed_translations.chinese: 奖，奖品；判定
detailed_translations.english: something such as a prize or money given to someone to reward them for something they have done

detailed_translations.chinese: 授予， 给予； 判给， 裁定
detailed_translations.english: to officially give someone something such as a prize or money to reward them for something they have done

name: buck
trans: 猛然弓背跃起 (vi.)
美元，澳元；雄鹿，雄兔 (n.)

sentences.english: The stallion bucked as he fought against the reins holding him tightly in.
sentences.chinese: 那匹种马四蹄离地狂跳，试图挣脱紧紧拴住它的缰绳。

detailed_translations.chinese: 猛然弓背跃起
detailed_translations.english: if a horse bucks, it kicks its back feet into the air, or jumps with all four feet off the ground

detailed_translations.chinese: 美元，澳元；雄鹿，雄兔
detailed_translations.english: a US, Canadian, or Australian dollar

name: eligible
trans: 有条件被选中的； 合适的， 合意的 (adj.)

sentences.english: Stephen was regarded as an eligible bachelor.
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂芬被认为是一个钻石王老五。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有条件被选中的； 合适的， 合意的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is eligible for something is able or allowed to do it, for example because they are the right age

name: alarm
trans: 惊恐，忧虑，警报 (n.)
使惊恐， 使担心 (vt.)

sentences.english: I forgot to set the burglar alarm.
sentences.chinese: 我忘记打开防盗警报器了。

sentences.english: Car alarms are always going off in the street.
sentences.chinese: 街上总有汽车警报器在响。

sentences.english: a sophisticated alarm system
sentences.chinese: 精密的警报系统

detailed_translations.chinese: 惊恐，忧虑，警报
detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that makes a loud noise to warn you of danger

detailed_translations.chinese: 使惊恐， 使担心
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel worried or frightened

name: feeble
trans: 虚弱的， 衰弱的， 无力的； 无效的， 无益的 (adj.)

sentences.english: His voice sounded feeble and far away.
sentences.chinese: 他的声音听上去既无力又遥远。

sentences.english: She was too feeble to leave her room.
sentences.chinese: 她身体虚弱，无法走出自己的房间。

detailed_translations.chinese: 虚弱的， 衰弱的， 无力的； 无效的， 无益的
detailed_translations.english: extremely weak

name: appraisal
trans: 估计， 估量； 评价 (n.)

sentences.english: What is needed in such cases is a calm appraisal of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 在此类情况下需要的是对形势的冷静估计。

detailed_translations.chinese: 估计， 估量； 评价
detailed_translations.english: a statement or opinion judging the worth, value, or condition of something

name: continual
trans: 连续的； 频频的 (adj.)

sentences.english: five weeks of continual rain
sentences.chinese: 持续了五个星期的降雨

sentences.english: the Japanese business philosophy of continual improvement
sentences.chinese: 日本人精益求精的经营哲学

detailed_translations.chinese: 连续的； 频频的
detailed_translations.english: continuing for a long time without stopping

name: herb
trans: 药草， 香草； 草本植物 (n.)

sentences.english: Sprinkle the dish with chopped fresh herbs.
sentences.chinese: 在菜肴上撒些切碎的新鲜香草。

name: prose
trans: 散文 (n.)

sentences.english: Shute's prose is stark and chillingly unsentimental.
sentences.chinese: 舒特的散文刻板而冷峻。

detailed_translations.chinese: 散文
detailed_translations.english: language in its usual form, as opposed to poetry

name: limb
trans: 肢， 臂， 腿； 树枝 (n.)

sentences.chinese: 她将可以伸开蜷缩的四肢，休息几个小时。

name: orientation
trans: 方向， 目标， 方位； 熟悉情况， 适应， 情况介绍 (n.)

sentences.chinese: 该政党大体上倾向于社会主义。

detailed_translations.english: the type of activity or subject that a person or organization seems most interested in and gives most attention to

name: refreshment
trans: 茶点， 点心； 恢复， 精神爽快 (n.)

sentences.chinese: 会后有茶点招待。

detailed_translations.chinese: 茶点， 点心； 恢复， 精神爽快
detailed_translations.english: small amounts of food and drink that are provided at a meeting, sports event etc

name: confidence
trans: 信任， 信赖； 信心， 自信 (n.)

sentences.chinese: 我觉得自己干得不错，自信心就开始增加了。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that you can trust someone or something to be good, work well, or produce good results

name: arbitrary
trans: 随心所欲的； 专断的 (adj.)

sentences.english: an arbitrary decision
sentences.chinese: 武断的决定

sentences.english: the arbitrary arrests of political opponents
sentences.chinese: 对政敌的任意逮捕

detailed_translations.chinese: 随心所欲的； 专断的
detailed_translations.english: decided or arranged without any reason or plan, often unfairly

name: intent
trans: 专心的， 专注的； 急切的 (adj.)
意图，意向，目的 (n.)

sentences.english: his intent gaze
sentences.chinese: 他专注的凝视

detailed_translations.chinese: 专心的， 专注的； 急切的
detailed_translations.english: giving careful attention to something so that you think about nothing else

detailed_translations.chinese: 意图，意向，目的
detailed_translations.english: what you intend to do

name: passive
trans: 被动的， 消极的 (adj.)

sentences.english: Kathy seems to take a very passive role in the relationship.
sentences.chinese: 凯茜在这一关系中似乎扮演着十分被动的角色。

sentences.english: their passive acceptance of their fate
sentences.chinese: 他们对命运的消极接受

detailed_translations.chinese: 被动的， 消极的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is passive tends to accept things that happen to them or things that people say to them, without taking any action

name: fertilizer
trans: 肥料 (n.)

sentences.english: ...farming without any purchased chemical, fertilizer or pesticide.
sentences.chinese: …不使用任何购买的化学品、肥料或杀虫剂的耕作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 肥料
detailed_translations.english: a substance that is put on the soil to make plants grow

name: corresponding
trans: 相应的， 符合的 (adj.)

sentences.english: The war and the corresponding fall in trade have had a devastating effect on the country.
sentences.chinese: 战争以及由此所导致的贸易量下降对这个国家产生了致命的影响。

detailed_translations.chinese: 相应的， 符合的
detailed_translations.english: caused by or connected with something you have already mentioned

name: oath
trans: 誓言， 誓约； 咒骂， 诅咒语 (n.)

sentences.english: The president took the oath of office (= made the official public promises that every president makes when starting their job ) .
sentences.chinese: 总统宣誓就职。

sentences.english: She could not break her oath .
sentences.chinese: 她不能违背誓言。

detailed_translations.chinese: 誓言， 誓约； 咒骂， 诅咒语
detailed_translations.english: a formal and very serious promise

name: response
trans: 回答， 答复； 反应， 响应 (n.)

sentences.english: His immediate response was one of disbelief.
sentences.chinese: 他的第一反应是不相信。

sentences.english: Emmett’s new exhibition has met with a favourable response from critics.
sentences.chinese: 埃米特的新展览得到评论家的好评。

detailed_translations.chinese: 回答， 答复； 反应， 响应
detailed_translations.english: something that is done as a reaction to something that has happened or been said

name: treaty
trans: 条约， 协议， 协定 (n.)

sentences.english: Both sides have agreed to sign the treaty .
sentences.chinese: 双方都同意签署该条约。

sentences.english: The peace treaty ends nearly four years of violence.
sentences.chinese: 该和平条约结束了将近四年的暴力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 条约， 协议， 协定
detailed_translations.english: a formal written agreement between two or more countries or governments

name: dignity
trans: 庄严， 端庄； 尊严， 高贵 (n.)

sentences.english: an appearance of quiet dignity
sentences.chinese: 肃穆的神态

detailed_translations.chinese: 庄严， 端庄； 尊严， 高贵
detailed_translations.english: the ability to behave in a calm controlled way even in a difficult situation

name: challenge
trans: 挑战，邀请比赛；艰巨的任务；怀疑，质问 (n.)
反对， 公然反抗； 向…挑战； 对…质疑 (vt.)

sentences.english: They threw down the challenge that he couldn’t wash 40 cars in one hour (= invited him to try to do it ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们激将他，说他不可能在1小时内擦洗40辆汽车。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑战，邀请比赛；艰巨的任务；怀疑，质问
detailed_translations.english: something that tests strength, skill, or ability, especially in a way that is interesting

detailed_translations.chinese: 反对， 公然反抗； 向…挑战； 对…质疑
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept that something is right, fair, or legal

name: rival
trans: 竞争的，对抗的 (adj.)
竞争对手，敌手；可与匹敌的人 (n.)
与…竞争； 与…匹敌， 比得上 (vt.)

sentences.english: He is, in effect, my rival.
sentences.chinese: 实际上他是我的竞争对手。

detailed_translations.chinese: 竞争的，对抗的
竞争对手，敌手；可与匹敌的人
detailed_translations.english: a person, group, or organization that you compete with in sport, business, a fight etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 与…竞争； 与…匹敌， 比得上
detailed_translations.english: to be as good or important as someone or something else
